newsitem.title: USA: Daschle sees increasing evidence budget deal today.
newsitem.headline: Daschle sees increasing evidence budget deal today.

text.p: U.S. Senate Democratic leader Tom Daschle said Thursday he saw "increasing evidence" a budget deal could be reached later in the day between congressional and White House negotiators.
He cautioned that any deal would only be the beginning of the process because it would still need to go through the House of Representatives and the Senate.
The South Dakota Democrat said he would not support any pact until he saw all the details.
"I'm not signing onto anything, no one should count any Democrat in support of this deal if there is one until we've seen the fine print, until we've seen the details," Daschle told reporters.
Daschle said the "increasing evidence" he saw for a potential budget pact was that the issues were all being "worked through" between the negotiators.
"All these pieces are moving targets, they're all within a range of anywhere from $10 (billion) to $50 billion," he said.
